importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the announcement of Ange Postecoglou's dismissal, marking a significant and swift managerial change in Premier League football history.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The duration of Ange Postecoglou's tenure, which is the shortest in Premier League history, highlights the abrupt nature of his departure.

keyTakeAways: Ange Postecoglou was dismissed by Nottingham Forest after just 39 days as manager, making it the fastest managerial exit in Premier League history.
Postecoglou failed to win a single game during his tenure, with only two draws and six losses, including a 3-0 defeat to Chelsea.
The dismissal follows the departure of Nuno Espírito Santo, who led the club to its best league finish in 30 years.
The club has now appointed its third manager of the season, indicating instability in leadership.
Postecoglou's exit is notable because of the swift nature and the public backlash, including booing from fans after a poor performance.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Ange Postecoglou, the Australian football manager, was swiftly dismissed by Nottingham Forest just 39 days after being appointed, becoming the fastest manager to be fired in Premier League history. His tenure was marked by zero wins, with only two draws and six losses, including a 3-0 defeat to Chelsea. The decision follows the departure of Nuno Espírito Santo, who had led the club to its highest league finish in 30 years. Postecoglou's exit, which included fan booing, underscores a significant leadership and performance crisis at the club, now leading to the search for a third manager of the season.
title: Nottingham Forest manager Ange Postecoglou fired after just 39 days at Premier League club
